Package com.bakdata.dedupe.similarity

Interface SimilarityMeasure<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type to which this similarity measure can be applied
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CollectionSimilarityMeasure<C,​E>, SetSimilarityMeasure<C,​E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AggregatingSimilarityMeasure, CachingSimilarity, CosineSimilarityMeasure, CutoffSimiliarityMeasure, Levenshtein, MatchingSimilarity, TransformingSimilarityMeasure, WeightedAggregatingSimilarityMeasure
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
    @FunctionalInterface
public interface SimilarityMeasure<T>
    A SimilarityMeasure compares two values and calculates a similarity in [-1; 1], where 0 means no similarity and 1 equal values in a given context.

    For example: Consider the edit (Levenshtein) distance.

    • "aa" and "ab" have a edit distance of 1, which will result in similarity of 0.5.
    • "aa" and "bb" have a edit distance of 2, which will result in similarity of 0.

      Returns true if sim(a, b) = sim(b, a).

      Replaces the similarity returned by this similarity, such that all values =0 result in an unknown() similarity.

    • Method Detail

      • unknown

        static double unknown()
        Returns a value indicating that the similarity value is unknown.

        Currently, unknown is encoded as NaN, which makes computation of compound similarity measures easier.

        Users that need to directly check for unknown results, should use isUnknown(double) to keep the code stable even after that value is changed.

        Note that unknown should not be used for comparison as unknown() != unknown().

        See Also:
        isUnknown(double)

      • isUnknown

        static boolean isUnknown​(double value)
        Checks whether the supplied value is unknown().
        Parameters:
        value - the value to check.
        Returns:
        true if value is the result of unknown().

      • isSymmetric

        default boolean isSymmetric()
        Returns true if sim(a, b) = sim(b, a).
        Returns:
        true if sim(a, b) = sim(b, a)

      • getSimilarity

        default double getSimilarity​(T left,
                             T right,
                             @NonNull
                             @NonNull SimilarityContext context)
        Calculates the similarity of the left and right value.

        Note that some similarities are non-commutative, so that the order of the parameters matters.

        In contrast to getNonNullSimilarity(Object, Object, SimilarityContext), this method allows null values for the left or right value.

        Parameters:
        left - the left element for which the similarity should be calculated.
        right - the right element for which the similarity should be calculated.
        context - the context of the comparison.
        Returns:
        the similarity [0; 1] or unknown() if no comparison can be performed (for example if left or right are null).
        Implementation Note:
        the default implementation returns SimilarityContext.getSimilarityForNull(Object, Object, SimilarityContext) if left or right is null and delegates to getNonNullSimilarity(Object, Object, SimilarityContext) otherwise.

      • getNonNullSimilarity

        double getNonNullSimilarity​(@NonNull
                            T left,
                            @NonNull
                            T right,
                            @NonNull
                            @NonNull SimilarityContext context)
        Calculates the similarity of the left and right value.

        Note that some similarities are non-commutative, so that the order of the parameters matters.

        Parameters:
        left - the left element for which the similarity should be calculated.
        right - the right element for which the similarity should be calculated.
        context - the context of the comparison.
        Returns:
        the similarity [0; 1] or unknown() if no comparison can be performed (for example if left or right are null).

      • of

        @NonNull
default <O> @NonNull SimilarityMeasure<O> of​(@NonNull
                                             @NonNull ValueTransformation<O,​? extends T> transformer)
        Applies a ValueTransformation to the left and right value of a similarity comparison before applying this .

        For example, to compare LocalDate with the edit distance, we need to transform it into a formatted string: levenshtein.of(ISO_FORMAT::format)

        Type Parameters:
        O - the output type after the transformation.
        Parameters:
        transformer - transforms the original input values.
        Returns:
        a similarity measure that transforms the input first before applying this similarity measure.

      • of

        @NonNull
default <O> @NonNull SimilarityMeasure<O> of​(@NonNull
                                             @NonNull java.util.function.Function<O,​? extends T> transformer)
        Applies a ValueTransformation to the left and right value of a similarity comparison before applying this .

        For example, to compare LocalDate with the edit distance, we need to transform it into a formatted string: levenshtein.of(ISO_FORMAT::format)

        Type Parameters:
        O - the output type after the transformation.
        Parameters:
        transformer - transforms the original input values.
        Returns:
        a similarity measure that transforms the input first before applying this similarity measure.

      • cutoff

        @NonNull
default @NonNull SimilarityMeasure<T> cutoff​(double threshold)
        Cuts the similarity returned by this similarity, such that all values <threshold result in a similarity of 0, and all values [threshold, 1] are left untouched.

        This method can be used to apply thresholds to parts of compounds similarity measures to avoid false positives resulting from an overall lenient threshold.

        Parameters:
        threshold - the threshold that divides the dissimilar and the similar values.
        Returns:
        a similarity measure replacing all similarities <threshold by 0.

      • scaleWithThreshold

        @NonNull
default @NonNull SimilarityMeasure<T> scaleWithThreshold​(double minExclusive)
        Scales the similarity returned by this similarity, such that all values ≤minExclusive result in a similarity of 0, and all values (minExclusive, 1] are linearly rescaled to (0, 1].

        This method can be used to apply thresholds to parts of compounds similarity measures to avoid false positives resulting from an overall lenient threshold.

        Parameters:
        minExclusive - the threshold that divides the dissimilar and the similar values.
        Returns:
        a similarity measure rescaling (minExclusive, 1] to (0, 1].

      • binarize

        @NonNull
default @NonNull SimilarityMeasure<T> binarize()
        Binarizes the similarity returned by this similarity, such that all values >0 result in a similarity of 1.

        This method can be used to treat somewhat dissimilar values equal and is mostly used after applying cutoff(double).

        Returns:
        a similarity measure replacing all similarities >0 with 1.

      • unknownIfZero

        @NonNull
default @NonNull SimilarityMeasure<T> unknownIfZero()
        Replaces the similarity returned by this similarity, such that all values =0 result in an unknown() similarity.

        This method makes parts of a compound similarity measure optional and is mostly used after applying cutoff(double).

        Returns:
        a similarity measure replacing all similarities =0 with unknown().

      • unknownIf

        @NonNull
default @NonNull SimilarityMeasure<T> unknownIf​(@NonNull
                                                @NonNull java.util.function.DoublePredicate scorePredicate)
        Replaces the similarity returned by this similarity, such that all values, for which the given predicate evaluates to true, result in an unknown() similarity.

        This method makes parts of a compound similarity measure optional and is mostly used after applying cutoff(double).

        Returns:
        a similarity measure replacing specific similarities with unknown().

      • negate

        @NonNull
default @NonNull SimilarityMeasure<T> negate()
        Swaps the lower and upper bound, such that equal pairs have a similarity of 0 and unequal pairs of 1.

        In particular, the returned similarity is 1 - this.sim.

        Returns:
        a negated similarity measure.
